00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 parserNumberWithUnits.pl - Implements a number with units.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 This is a Parser class that implements a number with units.
00024 It is a temporary version until the Parser can handle it
00025 directly.
00026 
00027 Use NumberWithUnits("num units") or NumberWithUnits(formula,"units")
00028 to generate a NumberWithUnits object, and then call its cmp method
00029 to get an answer checker for your number with units.
00030 
00031 Usage examples:
00032 
00033     ANS(NumberWithUnits("3 ft")->cmp);
00034     ANS(NumberWithUnits("$a*$b ft")->cmp);
00035     ANS(NumberWithUnits($a*$b,"ft")->cmp);
00036 
00037 We now call on the Legacy version, which is used by
00038 num_cmp to handle numbers with units.
00039 
00040 =cut
00041 
00042 loadMacros('MathObjects.pl');
00043 
00044 sub _parserNumberWithUnits_init {
00045   main::PG_restricted_eval('sub NumberWithUnits {Parser::Legacy::NumberWithUnits->new(@_)}');
00046 }
00047 
00048 1;
